meanings.definition: A physical or mental feature that is regarded as indicating a condition of disease.
meanings.sent1: Her cough was a symptom of the flu.
meanings.sent2: The doctor asked about any symptoms of illness.
meanings.sent3: His constant sneezing was a funny symptom of his allergy.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were a symptom of the impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The red rash on her skin was a vivid symptom of an allergic reaction.

meanings.definition: A sign of the existence of something, especially of an undesirable situation.
meanings.sent1: Lack of communication can be a symptom of a failing relationship.
meanings.sent2: The graffiti on the wall was a clear symptom of neglect in the area.
meanings.sent3: His messy room was a humorous symptom of his busy schedule.
meanings.sent4: The broken window was a symptom of the recent break-in.
meanings.sent5: The traffic jam was a striking symptom of the city's congestion issues.
